Gordon Easson (2 July 1928 – 2009) was a Scottish footballer, who played as a goalkeeper for East Fife and Worcester City.
Easson made his first team debut for East Fife in the 1950 Scottish Cup Final. This happened because their first two choice goalkeepers, John Niven and John McGarrity, were both injured. Easson conceded a goal within 30 seconds and East Fife went on to lose 3–0.

response: East Fife won the B Division championship in 1948. Niven appeared to be on course for further success in the 1949–50 season, but he was injured before the League Cup semi-final. East Fife won both the semi-final against Rangers and the final against Dunfermline without him. East Fife then reached the 1950 Scottish Cup Final, but Niven was injured in a league match five days earlier.
